---
title: Iliofemoral ligament
---

# Overview

The Iliofemoral ligament is the strongest of the 3 ligaments of the hip joint @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020.


# Origin {#origin}

# Insertion {#insertion}

# Function {#function}

- When taut, the Iliofemoral lig. prevents the pelvis from posteriorly tilting when in upright standing @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020.
- The iliofemoral ligament limits adduction when the hip is in extension @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020.
- The Iliofemoral lig. also stabilizes the pelvis on the stance side during gait @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020
